title: Understanding the ELSE Phrase
text: The ELSE phrase in an IF-THEN statement is used to specify what should happen if none of the specified conditions are true.

title: Purpose of ELSE
text: Think of the ELSE phrase as a fallback option. It ensures that there is a defined action even when all other conditions fail.

hintAnswer: It defines what to do if none of the explicit IF conditions are met.
title: Defining ELSE in IF-THEN
text: What does the ELSE phrase do in an IF-THEN statement?
choices: It defines what to do if none of the explicit IF conditions are met.
It introduces a list of conditions defining various categories.
